channel.title: Posts on .NET Ramblings
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on .NET Ramblings

item.title: Generative AI foundation model training on Amazon SageMaker
item.description: In this post, we explore how organizations can cost-effectively customize and adapt FMs using AWS managed services such as Amazon SageMaker training jobs and Amazon SageMaker HyperPod. We discuss how these powerful tools enable organizations to optimize compute resources and reduce the complexity of model training and fine-tuning. We explore how you can make an informed decision about which Amazon SageMaker service is most applicable to your business needs and requirements.

item.title: Automate fine-tuning of Llama 3.x models with the new visual designer for Amazon SageMaker Pipelines
item.description: In this post, we will show you how to set up an automated LLM customization (fine-tuning) workflow so that the Llama 3.x models from Meta can provide a high-quality summary of SEC filings for financial applications. Fine-tuning allows you to configure LLMs to achieve improved performance on your domain-specific tasks. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/automate-fine-tuning-of-llama-3-x-models-with-the-new-visual-designer-for-amazon-sagemaker-pipelines/

item.title: Implement Amazon SageMaker domain cross-Region disaster recovery using custom Amazon EFS instances
item.description: In this post, we guide you through a step-by-step process to seamlessly migrate and safeguard your SageMaker domain from one active Region to another passive or active Region, including all associated user profiles and files. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/implement-amazon-sagemaker-domain-cross-region-disaster-recovery-using-custom-amazon-efs-instances/

item.title: Soccer Analytics Copilot with Azure SQL and OpenAI
item.description: The Football (aka Soccer in US ğŸ˜€) Analisys Copilot provides an intuitive interface for users to interact with complex football data without needing advanced technical skills. By utilizing natural language processing, users can ask questions and retrieve detailed insights from vast datasets, including competitions, matches, teams, players, and events. This makes data exploration accessible to [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sql/soccer-analytics-copilot-with-azure-sql-and-openai

item.title: Exclusive Interview: Nana Janashia on Her Journey to DevOps and First Impressions of TeamCity Pipelines
item.description: Weâ€™re excited to bring you an exclusive interview with Nana Janashia, the mastermind behind the largest DevOps YouTube channel â€“ TechWorld with Nana. Nana has built an incredible career, sharing valuable insights about automation, cloud-native technologies, and everything DevOps with her global audience. But did you know that her journey started in marketing? In this [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/10/exclusive-interview-nana-janashia-teamcity-pipelines/

item.title: Docker at Cloud Expo Asia: GenAI, Security, and New Innovations
item.description: At Cloud Expo Asia 2024, Docker showcased its latest innovations in AI integration, security best practices, and product updates, highlighting how containers empower GenAI workflows and enable efficient, secure software development. Link to article: https://www.docker.com/blog/docker-at-cloud-expo-asia-genai-security-and-new-innovations/

item.title: .NET MAUI Welcomes Syncfusion Open-source Contributions
item.description: Announcing the release of the Syncfusion Toolkit for .NET MAUI, a set of free, open-source controls for .NET MAUI! Syncfusion has made 14 impressive UI controls freely available for .NET MAUI developers. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/dotnet-maui-welcomes-syncfusion-open-source-contributions

item.title: Did Windows 95 shrink the default font size of windowed MS-DOS apps?
item.description: The effect was that it shrunk, but only sometimes. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20241022-00/?p=110401

item.title: Youth Challenge Returns in November!
item.description: Prepare yourselves for the second season of the JetBrains Academy Youth Challenge, the competition for young coders and mathematicians. If you missed out last time or are ready to prove yourself again, this is your chance to win special prizes and compete with students worldwide. Choose your track The challenge continues with two tracks: math [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/education/2024/10/22/youth-challenge-returns-in-november/

item.title: Introducing Mellum: JetBrainsâ€™ New LLM Built for Developers
item.description: JetBrains has taken a major step forward in advancing AI-driven development tools with the launch of Mellum, a proprietary large language model (LLM) specifically designed to assist software developers. Currently available only with JetBrains AI Assistant, Mellum provides faster, smarter, and more contextually aware code completion. There are hundreds of LLMs. Why Mellum? Unlike typical [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/blog/2024/10/22/introducing-mellum-jetbrains-new-llm-built-for-developers/

item.title: Debug CMake Scripts on Linux with Visual Studio
item.description: If you are working on a CMake project that targets Linux, you may have encountered some challenges when trying to debug your CMake scripts and CMakeLists.txt files. You may have wondered why your variables are not set correctly, or why your custom commands are not executed as expected. Or you may have simply wanted to [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/debug-cmake-scripts-on-linux-with-visual-studio

item.title: DataGrip User Experience Survey Results
item.description: Introduction Recently, we conducted our first DataGrip UX Survey to better understand and prioritize the pain points that have the greatest impact on your experience. The data and feedback we gathered have helped us refine our plans to focus on what matters most to you. In this post, weâ€™ll highlight the key findings from the [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/datagrip/2024/10/22/datagrip-user-experience-survey-results/

item.title: Adding more extensions to Result<T>: Working with the result pattern - Part 3
item.description: In this post I show how to extend your LINQ-based result pattern code to handle more scenarios, such as Task> and collections of Result Link to article: https://andrewlock.net/working-with-the-result-pattern-part-3-adding-more-extensions/

item.title: Automating Godot Game Builds With TeamCity
item.description: Godot, an open-source game engine known for its versatility and simplicity, is gaining popularity among both indie developers and the broader game development community. While Godot comes with its own scripting language, GDScript, it also supports the widely-used C# language, familiar to Unity and Unreal Engine developers. In this tutorial, we will use â€œDodge the [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/10/automating-godot-game-builds-with-teamcity/

item.title: Stop exposing your MediatR command/query in minimal API
item.description: MediatR has become a popular tool for implementing the mediator pattern in .NET applications, allowing developers to decouple request handlers from their senders. While MediatR offers numerous benefits, exposing its commands directly in APIs can lead to unexpected complications. In this article, we'll explore the potential issues that Link to article: https://goatreview.com/stop-exposing-mediatr-command-minimal-api/

item.title: Boost Your .NET Projects: Maximizing Efficiency in .NET with Spargineâ€™s JsonSerialization Class
item.description: Spargine, an open-source .NET 8 project, includes essential assemblies and NuGet packages developed since .NET 2. The JsonSerialization class facilitates efficient JSON operations with methods for serialization, deserialization, and validation. Link to article: https://dotnettips.wordpress.com/2024/10/22/boost-your-net-projects-maximizing-efficiency-in-net-with-spargines-jsonserialization-class/

item.title: Exploring C# 11 Features: What's New and How to Use It
item.description: C# has been a popular programming language for many years now. It continuously evolves to include new features and adopt recent trends. Its flexibility makes it a language ideal for many different domains and platforms like desktop applications, enterprise systems, web development, games, cross-platform, and native mobile applications. Back when asd Link to article: https://blog.elmah.io/exploring-c-11-features-whats-new-and-how-to-use-it/

item.title: Java OpenJDK October 2024 Patch & Security Updates
item.description: Hello Java customers! We are happy to announce the latest October 2024 patch & security update release for the Microsoft Build of OpenJDK. Download and install the binaries today. OpenJDK 21.0.5 OpenJDK 17.0.13 OpenJDK 11.0.25 Check our release notes page for details on fixes and enhancements. The source code of our builds is available now [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/java/java-openjdk-oct-2024-patch-security-updates

item.title: Customer Case Study: How Microsoft streamlined regulatory compliance with GenAI
item.description: Customer Case Study: How Microsoft streamlined regulatory compliance with GenAI Today weâ€™re featuring an external blog from EY featuring Microsoftâ€™s Semantic Kernel. This case study reveals how Microsoft legal teams are using GenAI to confidently manage regulatory change. Learn more here: How Microsoft uses GenAI for compliance | EY â€“ Global How can you generate [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/semantic-kernel/customer-case-study-how-microsoft-streamlined-regulatory-compliance-with-genai

item.title: Amazon Bedrock Custom Model Import now generally available
item.description: Weâ€™re pleased to announce the general availability (GA) of Amazon Bedrock Custom Model Import. This feature empowers customers to import and use their customized models alongside existing foundation models (FMs) through a single, unified API. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/amazon-bedrock-custom-model-import-now-generally-available/

item.title: Windows MIDI Services October 2024 Update
item.description: Itâ€™s been a little while since I last posted an update about Windows MIDI Services outside of our Discord Server, but weâ€™ve been busy! With all the announcements today at Qualcommâ€™s Snapdragon Summit, I thought Iâ€™d dive in a bit on where we are with our new MIDI 1.0 and MIDI 2.0 stack on Windows. [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/windows-music-dev/windows-midi-services-oct-2024-update

item.title: Make Great Music with Windows on Arm
item.description: This week has been amazing, with our musician work really coming together at Qualcomm Snapdragon Summit 2024! Thereâ€™s only so much time available in a keynote, so I thought Iâ€™d expand a bit more on the music-related announcements, especially for the new in-box features. Music is all around us. We purposefully listen to music in [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/windows-music-dev/making-music-on-windows

item.title: Deploy a serverless web application to edit images using Amazon Bedrock
item.description: In this post, we explore a sample solution that you can use to deploy an image editing application by using AWS serverless services and generative AI services. We use Amazon Bedrock and an Amazon Titan FM that allow you to edit images by using prompts. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/deploy-a-serverless-web-application-to-edit-images-using-amazon-bedrock/

item.title: Brilliant words, brilliant writing: Using AWS AI chips to quickly deploy Meta LLama 3-powered applications
item.description: In this post, we will introduce how to use an Amazon EC2 Inf2 instance to cost-effectively deploy multiple industry-leading LLMs on AWS Inferentia2, a purpose-built AWS AI chip, helping customers to quickly test and open up an API interface to facilitate performance benchmarking and downstream application calls at the same time. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/brilliant-words-brilliant-writing-using-aws-ai-chips-to-quickly-deploy-meta-llama-3-powered-applications/

item.title: Best practices for building robust generative AI applications with Amazon Bedrock Agents â€“ Part 2
item.description: In this post, we dive into the architectural considerations and development lifecycle practices that can help you build robust, scalable, and secure intelligent agents. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/best-practices-for-building-robust-generative-ai-applications-with-amazon-bedrock-agents-part-2/

item.title: MongoDB EF Core Provider: Whatâ€™s New?
item.description: The latest updates to the MongoDB EF Core Provider brings updates to change tracking, index creation, complex queries, and transactions. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/mongodb-ef-core-provider-whats-new

item.title: CLion 2024.3 EAP 5: Support for the Call Hierarchy in CLion Nova and the New Project Status Widget
item.description: A new CLion 2024.3 EAP build, 243.20847.43, is out. You can download it for free from the link below, via the Toolbox App, or as a snap package if youâ€™re using Ubuntu. DOWNLOAD CLION 2024.3 EAP This build introduces two major features: support for function call hierarchy in CLion Nova and a new project status [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/clion/2024/10/clion-2024-3-eap-5/

item.title: Bridging the Gap Between the Classic and New UIs
item.description: Any significant update to the UI and UX of a professional tool is likely to pose challenges for its users. We recognize that the new UI of JetBrains IDEs represents a major change and understand how unsettling it can be when the software you rely on for productivity is significantly reworked. However, in order for [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/idea/2024/10/bridging-the-gap-between-the-classic-and-new-uis/

item.title: Updates to Azure Cosmos DBâ€™s Portal Networking Settings
item.description: We are happy to share with you an update to the Azure Cosmos DB networking configuration options within the Azure Portal. This update introduces a split in the IP address list, now presented as two distinct categories: user IP addresses and Portal Middleware IPs.Â Managing IP access control policies is essential for maintaining a secure [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/updates-to-azure-cosmos-dbs-portal-networking-settings

item.title: Why does adding WS_MINIMIZEÂ­BOX change how my window behaves when the user presses Win+D?
item.description: It minimizes your window if it can. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20241021-00/?p=110393

item.title: Using Docker AI Tools for Devs to Provide Context for Better Code Fixes
item.description: Learn how to map your codebase in order to provide context for creating better AI-generated code fixes. Link to article: https://www.docker.com/blog/using-docker-ai-tools-for-devs-to-provide-context-for-better-code-fixes/

item.title: IntelliJ IDEA 2024.3 EAP 6: Updated Structure Tool Window, Streamlined GraalVM Native Image Debugging, and More
item.description: The latest IntelliJ IDEA 2024.3 EAP build is here, bringing new features and improvements for you to explore! You can download this version from our website, update directly from within the IDE, use the free Toolbox App, or install it via snap packages for Ubuntu. Download IntelliJ IDEA 2024.3 EAP 6 In this update, weâ€™ve [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/idea/2024/10/intellij-idea-2024-3-eap-6/

item.title: Implement security headers for an ASP.NET Core API supporting OpenAPI Swagger UI
item.description: This article shows how to implement security headers for an application supporting an API and a swagger UI created from a open API in .NET 9. The security headers are implemented using the NetEscapades.AspNetCore.SecurityHeaders Nuget packages from Andrew Lock. Code: https://github.com/damienbod/WebApiOpenApi Deploying a web application which supports both an API and a UI have different [â€¦] Link to article: https://damienbod.com/2024/10/21/implement-security-headers-for-an-api-supporting-openapi-swagger-ui/

item.title: Entity Framework Core Best Practices
item.description: Entity Framework Core (EF Core) is an object-relational mapper (ORM), enabling us to work with a database using .NET objects, eliminating much of the data-access code we usually need to write. EF Core supports many databases, including SQL Server, SQLite, PostgreSQL, MySQL, and more, making it highly versatile. While EF Core provides many conveniences, following [â€¦] The post Entity Framework Core Best Practices appeared first on Code Maze. Link to article: https://code-maze.

item.title: Announcing IBM Granite AI Models Now Available on Docker Hub
item.description: IBM's Granite AI models, optimized for business applications, are now available on Docker Hub, making it easier for developers to deploy, scale, and customize AI-powered apps. Link to article: https://www.docker.com/blog/announcing-ibm-granite-ai-models-now-available-on-docker-hub/

item.title: Combo HTTP Endpoint and Message Handler with Wolverine 3.0
item.description: With the release of Wolverine 3.0 last week, we snuck in a small feature at the last minute that was a request from a JasperFx Software customer. Specifically, they had a couple instances of a logical message type that needed to be handled both from Wolverineâ€™s Rabbit MQ message transport, and also from the request â€¦ Continue reading Combo HTTP Endpoint and Message Handler with WolverineÂ 3.0 â†’ Link to article: https://jeremydmiller.

item.title: Boost Your .NET Projects: Unleashing the Power of Spargineâ€™s Dictionary Extension Methods
item.description: Spargine is an open-source set of assemblies and NuGet packages for .NET 8, offering enhanced functionality for IDictionary collection types. The provided extension methods improve performance and reliability in projects. Community involvement and feedback are encouraged for further enhancements. Detailed benchmark results are available on GitHub. Contact dotnetdave@live.com for contributions and inquiries. Link to article: https://dotnettips.wordpress.com/2024/10/20/boost-your-net-projects-unleashing-the-power-of-spargines-dictionary-extension-methods/

item.title: 4 Lessons From Building a SaaS â€“ Dev Leader Weekly 66
item.description: The post 4 Lessons From Building a SaaS â€“ Dev Leader Weekly 66 appeared first on Dev Leader.Welcome to another issue of Dev Leader Weekly! In this issue, I discuss the lessons I've learned while building a SaaS The post 4 Lessons From Building a SaaS â€“ Dev Leader Weekly 66 appeared first on Dev Leader. Link to article: https://www.devleader.ca/2024/10/19/4-lessons-from-building-a-saas-dev-leader-weekly-66/

item.title: Problem Details for ASP.NET Core APIs
item.description: Discover how to leverage Problem Details in ASP.NET Core to create consistent, informative API error responses that enhance developer experience and comply with RFC 9457. This comprehensive guide explores the latest features in .NET 8 and 9, demonstrating how to implement custom exception handlers, utilize IProblemDetailsService, and apply best practices for robust error handling in your APIs. Link to article: https://www.milanjovanovic.tech/blog/problem-details-for-aspnetcore-apis

item.title: Train, optimize, and deploy models on edge devices using Amazon SageMaker and Qualcomm AI Hub
item.description: In this post we introduce an innovative solution for end-to-end model customization and deployment at the edge using Amazon SageMaker and Qualcomm AI Hub. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/train-optimize-and-deploy-models-on-edge-devices-using-amazon-sagemaker-and-qualcomm-ai-hub/

item.title: .NET Conf 2024 Student Zone
item.description: The .NET Conf Student Zone is a beginner-friendly, virtual event where experts will teach you how to build amazing projects - all using C# and .NET! Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/dotnetconf-2024-student-zone

item.title: Enhanced Breakpoint Expressions for C++ Debugging in Visual Studio
item.description: Conditional Breakpoints Performance Improvement Debugging C++ code can be a time-consuming process, especially when dealing with complex scenarios. As a developer, itâ€™s frustrating to go through extensive setup and wait for a specific conditional breakpoint to trigger so you can analyze your application in a specific state. In Visual Studio 2022 version 17.10, we optimized [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cppblog/enhanced-breakpoint-expressions-for-c-debugging-in-visual-studio

item.title: Creating an ASP.Net application with External ID using Visual Studio
item.description: Integrate Microsoft Entra External ID into your ASP.NET application using Visual Studio. Learn how External ID simplifies user authentication, improves your security posture, and reduces vulnerabilities. Whether you're new to identity management, or more experienced, this tutorial equips you with the guidance to enhance security and efficiency in your applications. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/identity/integrating-ext-id-using-vs

item.title: Using Amazon Q Business with AWS HealthScribe to gain insights from patient consultations
item.description: In this post, we discuss how you can use AWS HealthScribe with Amazon Q Business to create a chatbot to quickly gain insights into patient clinician conversations. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/using-amazon-q-business-with-aws-healthscribe-to-gain-insights-from-patient-consultations/

item.title: JetBrains at the ICPC World Finals 2024 Astana
item.description: This yearâ€™s ICPC World Finals Astana was remarkable, and we were thrilled to be a part of it. The event brought together the worldâ€™s brightest young minds in competitive programming. Engaging with students, coaches, and the community was a valuable experience that reinforced our commitment to supporting emerging talent. The Opening Ceremony held at the [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/blog/2024/10/17/jetbrains-icpc-world-finals-2024-astana/

item.title: Use Amazon SageMaker Studio with a custom file system in Amazon EFS
item.description: In this post, we explore three scenarios demonstrating the versatility of integrating Amazon EFS with SageMaker Studio. These scenarios highlight how Amazon EFS can provide a scalable, secure, and collaborative data storage solution for data science teams. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/use-amazon-sagemaker-studio-with-a-custom-file-system-in-amazon-efs/

item.title: Summarize call transcriptions securely with Amazon Transcribe and Amazon Bedrock Guardrails
item.description: In this post, we show you how to use Amazon Transcribe to get near real-time transcriptions of calls sent to Amazon Bedrock for summarization and sensitive data redaction. Weâ€™ll walk through an architecture that uses AWS Step Functions to orchestrate the process, providing seamless integration and efficient processing Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/summarize-call-transcriptions-securely-with-amazon-transcribe-and-amazon-bedrock-guardrails/

item.title: Benefits of Code-First Infrastructure Deployments with HashiCorp Terraform and Azure Bicep
item.description: Whether youâ€™re a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE), Cloud Engineer, or IT Admin, you will be required to spin up, configure, and manage all sorts of cloud resources. A code-first infrastructure approach to deploying and managing cloud resources will offer you and your team many benefits over the long term when it comes to infrastructure automation, [â€¦] The article Benefits of Code-First Infrastructure Deployments with HashiCorp Terraform and Azure Bicep was originally published on Build5Nines.

item.description: Hello, itâ€™s Kodee here, your favorite Kotlin mascot. I thought, who would be better to bring you all the exciting news from the Kotlin ecosystem than the cutest member of the team â€“ me. So, without further ado, letâ€™s jump right in! Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/kotlin/2024/10/kodee-s-kotlin-roundup-exciting-news-special-announcement/

item.title: Wolverine 3.0 is Live!
item.description: Just as the title says, Wolverine 3.0 is live and published to Nuget! I believe that this release addresses some of Wolverineâ€™s prior weaknesses and adds some powerful new features requested by our users. The journey for Wolverine right now is to be the singular most effective set of tooling for building robust, maintainable, and â€¦ Continue reading Wolverine 3.0 isÂ Live! â†’ Link to article: https://jeremydmiller.com/2024/10/16/wolverine-3-0-is-live/

item.title: Introducing Pull Request Annotation for CodeQL and Dependency Scanning in GitHub Advanced Security for Azure DevOps
item.description: In the world of software development, security is paramount. As developers, we strive to write clean, efficient, and most importantly, secure code. GitHub Advanced Security for Azure DevOps has always been at the forefront of providing tools that make it easier to build and release high-quality software. Today, weâ€™re excited to announce a new feature [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/devops/introducing-pull-request-annotation-for-codeql-and-dependency-scanning-in-github-advanced-security-for-azure-devops

item.title: API Error Messages for a GOOD Developer Experience
item.description: Debugging and troubleshooting are a big part of a developerâ€™s day-to-day. Because of this, when designing your APIs, provide good API error messages as well as guide developers down a path of success and makes it easier for them to understand issues when they need to troubleshoot. YouTube Check out myÂ YouTube channel,Â where I post allâ€¦Â Read More Â»API Error Messages for a GOOD Developer Experience The post API Error Messages for a GOOD Developer Experience appeared first on CodeOpinion.

item.title: How DPG Media uses Amazon Bedrock and Amazon Transcribe to enhance video metadata with AI-powered pipelines
item.description: In this post, we share how DPG Media is introducing AI-powered processes using Amazon Bedrock into its video publication pipelines. This solution is helping accelerate audio metadata extraction, create a more engaging user experience, and save time. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/how-dpg-media-uses-amazon-bedrock-and-amazon-transcribe-to-enhance-video-metadata-with-ai-powered-pipelines/

item.title: How SailPoint uses Anthropicâ€™s Claude on Amazon Bedrock to automatically generate TypeScript code for SaaS connectors
item.description: In this post, we highlight how the AWS Generative AI Innovation Center collaborated with SailPoint Technologies to build a generative AI-based coding assistant that uses Anthropicâ€™s Claude Sonnet on Amazon Bedrock to help accelerate the development of software as a service (SaaS) connectors. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/how-sailpoint-uses-anthropics-claude-on-amazon-bedrock-to-automatically-generate-typescript-code-for-saas-connectors/

item.title: Map Earthâ€™s vegetation in under 20 minutes with Amazon SageMaker
item.description: In this post, we demonstrate the power of SageMaker geospatial capabilities by mapping the worldâ€™s vegetation in under 20 minutes. This example not only highlights the efficiency of SageMaker, but also its impact how geospatial ML can be used to monitor the environment for sustainability and conservation purposes. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/map-earths-vegetation-in-under-20-minutes-with-amazon-sagemaker/

item.title: Improve your debugger game with editable expressions
item.description: Do you ever wish you could quickly test different queries on your collections or datasets while debugging? Do you want to save time and avoid writing code just to inspect your data? If you answered yes, then you will love the new editable expression feature in the Visual Studio debugger. This feature allows you to [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/improve-your-debugger-game-with-editable-expressions

item.title: Unlocking insights and enhancing customer service: Intactâ€™s transformative AI journey with AWS
item.description: In this post, we demonstrate how Intact's Call Quality solution used Amazon Transcribe and other AWS services to improve critical KPIs with AI-powered contact center call auditing and analytics. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/unlocking-insights-and-enhancing-customer-service-intacts-transformative-ai-journey-with-aws/

item.title: How we build GitHub Copilot into Visual Studio
item.description: Find out how Visual Studio integrates GitHub Copilot, architectural detail, .NET implementation, and the importance of the indexing service for providing context-aware AI code suggestions. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/building-github-copilot-into-visual-studio

item.description: Read how Microsoft 365 Certification verifies information security risk management. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/microsoft365dev/microsoft-365-control-spotlight-information-security-risk-management

item.description: Return address manipulations that are possibly even more impermissible than they already were. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20241016-00/?p=110378

item.description: Docker IT deployed Docker Desktop to hundreds of macOS and Windows devices in 24 hours. Here's how they did it. Link to article: https://www.docker.com/blog/how-docker-it-streamlined-docker-desktop-deployment/

item.title: Code Analysis for Your Projects With IntelliJ IDEA and Qodana
item.description: As developers, we spend more time maintaining existing code than we do writing new code. Any tools that can help make this easier can save us a lot of time. In this blog post series, weâ€™ll look at several ways that code analysis in IntelliJ IDEA can help you find and fix problems in your [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/idea/2024/10/code-analysis-for-your-projects-with-intellij-idea-and-qodana/

item.title: Compose Multiplatform 1.7.0 Released
item.description: Compose Multiplatform is a declarative UI framework built by JetBrains that allows developers to share UI implementations across different platforms. The 1.7.0 release brings more components to common code, support for type-safe navigation, significant performance improvements on iOS, and changes from the latest Jetpack Compose update. Here are the highlights of this release: For the [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/kotlin/2024/10/compose-multiplatform-1-7-0-released/

item.title: Accelerate migration portfolio assessment using Amazon Bedrock
item.description: In this blog post, we will harness the power of generative AI and Amazon Bedrock to help organizations simplify, accelerate, and scale migration assessments. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/accelerate-migration-portfolio-assessment-using-amazon-bedrock/

item.title: Improve public speaking skills using a generative AI-based virtual assistant with Amazon Bedrock
item.description: In this post, we present an Amazon Bedrock powered virtual assistant that can transcribe presentation audio and examine it for language use, grammatical errors, filler words, and repetition of words and sentences to provide recommendations as well as suggest a curated version of the speech to elevate the presentation. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/improve-public-speaking-skills-using-a-generative-ai-based-virtual-assistant-with-amazon-bedrock/

item.title: Bria 2.3, Bria 2.2 HD, and Bria 2.3 Fast are now available in Amazon SageMaker JumpStart

item.description: In this post, we show how the SageMaker Core SDK simplifies the developer experience while providing API for seamlessly executing various steps in a general ML lifecycle. We also discuss the main benefits of using this SDK along with sharing relevant resources to learn more about this SDK. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/introducing-sagemaker-core-a-new-object-oriented-python-sdk-for-amazon-sagemaker/

item.title: Introducing Organization Access Tokens
item.description: Docker organization access tokens let customers manage access that each token has, instead of managing users and their placement within the organization. Link to article: https://www.docker.com/blog/introducing-organization-access-tokens/

item.description: Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth is a powerful data labeling service offered by AWS that provides a comprehensive and scalable platform for labeling various types of data, including text, images, videos, and 3D point clouds, using a diverse workforce of human annotators. In addition to traditional custom-tailored deep learning models, SageMaker Ground Truth also supports generative [â€¦] Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/create-a-data-labeling-project-with-amazon-sagemaker-ground-truth-plus/

item.title: Supercharging .NET Collections with Span and MemoryExtensions
item.description: This article discusses optimizing code efficiency in .NET using Span and MemoryExtensions for collection operations. It highlights significant performance improvements in common tasks such as finding, sorting, and reversing collections, demonstrating that these tools minimize memory allocations and enhance speed. Benchmark results underscore substantial advantages in performance and efficiency. Link to article: https://dotnettips.wordpress.com/2024/10/15/supercharging-net-collections-with-span-and-memoryextensions/

item.title: What's new in .NET 9: Cryptography improvements
item.description: .NET 9 is releasing in mid-November 2024. Like every .NET version, this introduces several important features and enhancements aligning developers with an ever-changing development ecosystem. In this blog series, I will explore critical updates in different areas of .NET.Â For today's post, I'll present some improvements asd Link to article: https://blog.elmah.io/whats-new-in-net-9-cryptography-improvements/

item.title: C# Tip: IEnumerable vs ICollection, and why it matters
item.description: When working with Lists in C#, you are working on a data structure that implements both ICollection and IEnumerable. Whatâ€™s the difference between ICollection and IEnumerable? Why should you care about them, especially when exposing functionalities to external clients? Link to article: https://www.code4it.dev/csharptips/ienumerable-vs-icollection/
